questions.question: 3. What is the correct representation (in terms of switches) for two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 1?

explanations.a: This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 0. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.b: This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 1 & 0. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.c: This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 1 & 1. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.d: This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 1. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
